repnme.cdata!: Saint Lucia - Basic Education Reform Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the Basic
            Education Reform Project is rated as satisfactory. Lessons
            learned from this project include: It is important that all
            persons who are expected to implement the project
            participate in the analysis of issues and the design of the
            project. Design of schools should be based on the actual
            building sites selected, and functions must be discussed
            with end users to ensure that the curricula can be
            effectively delivered, and cost estimates are realistic.
            Projects with a heavy organizational change component should
            include a communication and change management strategy so
            that all stakeholders are fully aware of the objectives,
            strategies, and implications. Objectives such as gender
            equity and poverty reduction require specific measures to
            ensure their realization. Unit involved in project
            implementation should be staffed with trained personnel
            throughout the life of the project, particularly in critical
            areas such as procurement. Management of the implementing
            agency and Project Advisory Committees must provide the
            necessary direction and support to ensure the success of the
            project. Attention must be given to ensuring that studies,
            formulation of policies, systems for monitoring efficiency
            and effectiveness are implemented in a timely manner.
            Fellows must be selected carefully and arrangements made for
            trained personnel to be deployed appropriately to allow for
            transfer of knowledge and application of skills.

            REFORM PROJECTS,TF022788-PHRD-BASIC EDUCATION PROJECT,TF022789-PHRD-BASIC EDUCATION PROJECT,TF022719-PHRD-BASIC EDUCATION PROJECT,TF032383-LAC REGION - EDUCATION;HEATLH

repnme.cdata!: Saint Lucia - Basic Education Reform Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Basic Education Reform Project has
            the overall objective of accelerating resource development
            to ensure that the requisite manpower exists to attain the
            desired economic transition in Saint Lucia. It supports the
            first stage of a major reform of basic education, aimed at
            increasing the efficiency and effectiveness of the education
            system, and at enhancing equity of access to educational
            opportunities. To these ends, a dual strategy will be
            pursued. The first part seeks to strengthen the planning and
            institutional capacity of the Ministry of Education to guide
            and carry out the long-term development of the sector, while
            enabling it to initiate significant, urgent measures to
            address system-wide qualitative problems and expansion needs
            at the secondary level. As a second, integral part of the
            strategy, the project catalyzes a major adjustment process,
            focused on revision to more reasonable levels of primary and
            secondary teacher to student ratios, in line with ratios of
            countries at similar levels of economic and social
            development. Such adjustment is critical to ensure that
            already relatively high levels of resource allocations to
            public education better respond to current and projected
            needs, including increased financing for system management
            and educational equipment and supplies, and school
            facilities and equipment maintenance - all of which are
            areas presently significantly underfinanced.
